CandidateProfile.hr:ExecutiveSummary: I am a software engineer and researcher with a passion for interoperable and privacy-aware (information) systems.

PositionHistory.oa:Description: 6-year Ph.D grant on indoor positioning and interoperability. Teaching assistant for various Bachelor and Master courses.
Freelance software development and consultancy. Projects spanning from web development to IoT and AI implementation in business processes.
Maintenance of chemical database search by substructures.
Development and maintenance of chemical database software.
Migration from Access database to Web-based chemical database software.
Development of PHP and MySQL based chemical database software.
Development of QR-code based appointment system. Google Fit integration for patients. Healthcare software development.
eID cloud authentication Bachelor thesis preparatory training.
eID cloud authentication and security penetration testing.
Web UI for print management software.
File server deployment and print job submitting in C#.

EducationDegree.Thesis: Interoperable and Discoverable Indoor Positioning Systems

EducationDegree.hr:DegreeName: Master of Science (MSc), Applied Computer Science
EducationDegree.OccupationalSkillsCovered: Parallelism, distributed systems, multicore programming (Java, Erlang and GPU with OpenCL), software security and Indoor navigation master thesis.
Bridging programme from professional bachelor to academic bachelor.
Software Security, Software Development (Java, C++, C#, Objective-C), Agile development. Received an award for best final work.

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: 'Locatiegegevens zijn big business', zegt doctoraatsonderzoeker Maxim Van de Wynckel. Zulke data worden door een hele rist aan applicaties en andere diensten opgeslagen. 'Denk aan navigatie- en fitnessapps, maar ook aan wifi- en bluetooth-signalen. Gebruikers zijn zich vaak niet bewust van die onzichtbare vormen van dataverzameling'. Recente gebeurtenissen tonen aan hoe kwetsbaar locatiegegevens zijn.
Publication.Title: Jong Talent: Maxim Van de Wynckel (30) zoekt oplossingen om gebruikers meer controle te geven over hun locatiegegevens

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: Computer vision tracking and dead reckoning sensor fusion of a Sphero robot
Publication.Title: Sphero Dead Reckoning and CV Tracking Dataset
Publication.Reference: Van de Wynckel, M., & Signer, B. (2025). Sphero Dead Reckoning and CV Tracking Dataset. Kaggle. https://doi.org/10.34740/KAGGLE/DS/6760212

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: A fingerprinting dataset consisting of WLAN, BLE and IMU data in a garage
Publication.Title: Garage Positioning Dataset
Publication.Reference: Van de Wynckel, M. (2025). Garage Positioning Dataset. Kaggle. https://doi.org/10.34740/KAGGLE/DS/6654647

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: This paper proposes a decentralised approach to intelligent tutoring systems by storing learning progress and performance data in user-owned Solid Pods, enhancing learner autonomy and privacy.
Publication.Title: Towards Distributed Intelligent Tutoring Systems Based on User-owned Progress and Performance Data
Publication.Reference: Malaise, Y., Van de Wynckel, M., & Signer, B. (2024, May). Towards Distributed Intelligent Tutoring Systems Based on User-owned Progress and Performance Data. Proceedings of SoSy 2024 (Poster), 2nd Solid Symposium, Leuven, Belgium, May 2024.

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: In this paper, we propose a novel solution to store 3D manipulations in AR spaces within a Solid pod. Using this solution, multiple users can work together in the same environment while also ensuring interoperability between AR applications.
Publication.Title: Discoverable and Interoperable Augmented Reality Environments Through Solid Pods
Publication.Reference: Van de Wynckel, M., & Signer, B. (2024, May). Discoverable and Interoperable Augmented Reality Environments Through Solid Pods. Proceedings of SoSy 2024 (Poster), 2nd Solid Symposium, Leuven, Belgium, May 2024. https://events.vito.be/sosy2024

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: In this publication, we propose an ontology called FidMark for semantically describing fiducial markers. This ontology is useful for AR and robotics applications to ensure interoperability between systems.
Publication.Title: FidMark: A Fiducial Marker Ontology for Semantically Describing Visual Markers
Publication.Reference: Van de Wynckel, M., Valadez, I., & Signer, B. (2024). FidMark: A Fiducial Marker Ontology for Semantically Describing Visual Markers. Proceedings of The Semantic Web (ESWC 2024), 235–250. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-031-60635-9_14

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: In this publication we propose the SemBeacon specification, which is a semantic beacon solution to discover and detect the position of physical things such as IoT devices, environments or services.
Publication.Title: SemBeacon: A Semantic Proximity Beacon Solution for Discovering and Detecting the Position of Physical Things
Publication.Reference: Van de Wynckel, M., & Signer, B. (2023). SemBeacon: A Semantic Proximity Beacon Solution for Discovering and Detecting the Position of Physical Things. Proceedings of the 13th International Conference on the Internet of Things, 9–16.

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: In this dataset, two separate datasets were recorded in a Belgian train station to collect 802.11 wireless management frames. The datasets were anonymised and contain data on the SSIDs, signal strengths and MAC addresses.
Publication.Title: 802.11 Managemement frames from a public location
Publication.Reference: Vermunicht, B., Van de Wynckel, M., & Signer, B. (2023). 802.11 Managemement frames from a public location. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.8003771

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: In this dataset, a Monopoly game was recorded from a first person perspective. The aim of this dataset is to conduct pawn and object tracking using computer vision algorithms.
Publication.Title: Object Tracking on a Monopoly Game Board
Publication.Reference: Hoebeke, N., Van de Wynckel, M., & Signer, B. (2023). Object Tracking on a Monopoly Game Board. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.7990434

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: In this publication we propose the POSO ontology, which is a positioning system ontology to semantically describe positioning systems, the data they produce and the environments in which these systems are deployed.
Publication.Title: POSO: A Generic Positioning System Ontology
Publication.Reference: Van de Wynckel, M., & Signer, B. (2022). POSO: A Generic Positioning System Ontology. The Semantic Web – ISWC 2022, 231–247. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-031-19433-7_14

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: In this publication we propose a solution to decentralise location data and positioning systems in Solid pods using linked data.
Publication.Title: A Solid-based Architecture for Decentralised Interoperable Location Data
Publication.Reference: Van de Wynckel, M., & Signer, B. (2022). A Solid-based Architecture for Decentralised Interoperable Location Data. Proceedings of the 12th International Conference on Indoor Positioning and Indoor Navigation (IPIN), CEUR Workshop Proceedings.

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: In this publication, we propose OpenHPS, an open source hybrid positioning system. We demonstrate how OpenHPS can be used to create indoor positioning systems.
Publication.Title: Indoor Positioning Using the OpenHPS Framework
Publication.Reference: Van de Wynckel, M., & Signer, B. (2021). Indoor Positioning Using the OpenHPS Framework. 2021 International Conference on Indoor Positioning and Indoor Navigation (IPIN), 1–8. https://doi.org/10.1109/IPIN51156.2021.9662569

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: In this dataset, we collected fingerprints of Wi-Fi access points and BLE beacons in a building. The fingerprints are collected in four directions and cover an entire floor.
Publication.Title: OpenHPS: Single Floor Fingerprinting and Trajectory Dataset
Publication.Reference: Van de Wynckel, M., & Signer, B. (2021). OpenHPS: Single Floor Fingerprinting and Trajectory Dataset. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4744380

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: In this technical report, we provide a technical overview of the OpenHPS framework. OpenHPS is a framework to design a wide range of hybrid positioning systems using TypeScript.
Publication.Title: OpenHPS: An Open Source Hybrid Positioning System
Publication.Reference: Van de Wynckel, M., & Signer, B. (2020). OpenHPS: An Open Source Hybrid Positioning System (WISE-2020-01). Vrije Universiteit Brussel. https://doi.org/10.48550/ARXIV.2101.05198

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: The goal of my Master thesis was to design an indoor navigation system that guides patients and visitors inside a hospital. The solution was designed to require minimal setup and interaction by both the hospital and users.
Publication.Title: Master thesis: Indoor Navigation by Centralized Tracking
Publication.Reference: Van de Wynckel, M. (2019). Indoor Navigation by Centralized Tracking [Master’s thesis, Vrije Universiteit Brussel]. https://researchportal.vub.be/en/studentTheses/indoor-navigation-by-centralized-tracking

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: My bachelor thesis was designed for the company BITPOWER. Using the European Identity card (eID), remote authorisation access could be granted via a mobile application.
Publication.Title: Bachelor thesis: eID IO - Applicatie besturing
Publication.Reference: My bachelor thesis was to provide remote actions for eID authentication. It was awarded the best thesis of the class of 2016.

Publication.hr:FormattedPublicationDescription: My final work during the last year of my highschool was a database migration tool for migrating the Flemish student database to other platforms used by students.
Publication.Title: Final work: WisaReg
Publication.Reference: WisaReg is an application that provides newly registered students from the Wisa database with accounts for various services. It was awarded the best final work of 2013.

ConferenceAndSeminar.Title: Presentation at FOSDEM 2025
ConferenceAndSeminar.Description: Presentation titled 'Discovering Indoor Environments and Positioning Systems'

ConferenceAndSeminar.Title: Conference presentation at ESWC 2024
ConferenceAndSeminar.Description: Paper presentation titled 'FidMark: A Fiducial Marker Ontology for Semantically Describing Visual Markers'

ConferenceAndSeminar.Title: Poster presentation at SoSy 2024
ConferenceAndSeminar.Description: Poster presentation titled 'Discoverable and Interoperable Augmented Reality Environments Through Solid Pods'

ConferenceAndSeminar.Title: Conference presentation at IoT 2023
ConferenceAndSeminar.Description: Paper presentation titled 'SemBeacon: A Semantic Proximity Beacon Solution for Discovering and Detecting the Position of Physical Things'

ConferenceAndSeminar.Title: Poster presentation at BeJS conf 2023
ConferenceAndSeminar.Description: Poster presentation of the OpenHPS framework

ConferenceAndSeminar.Title: Conference presentation at ISWC 2022
ConferenceAndSeminar.Description: Paper presentation titled 'POSO: A Generic Positioning System Ontology'

ConferenceAndSeminar.Title: Conference presentation at IPIN 2022
ConferenceAndSeminar.Description: Paper presentation titled 'A Solid-based Architecture for Decentralised Interoperable Location Data'

ConferenceAndSeminar.Title: Presentation at FOSDEM 2022
ConferenceAndSeminar.Description: Presentation titled 'Rapid Prototyping of a Positioning System Using the OpenHPS Framework'

ConferenceAndSeminar.Title: Conference presentation at IPIN 2021
ConferenceAndSeminar.Description: Paper presentation titled 'Indoor Positioning Using the OpenHPS Framework'

HobbyOrInterest.Title: Scuba diving
HobbyOrInterest.Description: 3* (Bachelor) diver at the VUB Diving Center

Project.Title: OpenHPS
Project.Description: OpenHPS is an open source hybrid positioning system to help developers fuse various positioning technologies and algorithms. The system offers a modular data processing framework with each modules ranging from computer vision to common algorithms such as fingerprinting or data persistence of sampled data.

Project.Title: SemBeacon
Project.Description: SemBeacon is an ongoing project for the development of a semantic Bluetooth Low Energy beacon specification that helps to describe the beacon itself, its deployment and the positioning system used within.

Project.Title: SpigotMC Plugins
Project.Description: I am an active member of the SpigotMC.org developer community. Having developed software that has been sold to more than 20,000 users since 2014

Project.Title: EhB Rooster
Project.Description: EhBRooster.be was a project aimed at improving the usability of timetables for Erasmushogeschool Brussel, gaining significant interest from students and staff. Developed in Java and PHP, the website influenced the adoption of a new timetable system before its discontinuation in 2018.

Project.Title: eIDIO Cloud Authentication
Project.Description: eIDIO was a platform developed by BITPOWER to provide secure eID access to buildings. I was tasked to expand this platform with cloud authentication.

Project.Title: Shutti
Project.Description: Shutti was a set of software tools developed for Windows that enabled users to optimize, schedule and automate their computer's power management settings.

Project.Title: WisaReg
Project.Description: My final work at my highschool was a project called WisaReg. WisaReg is a database migration tool to convert data from the Wisa database to other internal databases. The tool aimed to help the ICT administrators to automatically create new user accounts in LDAP, Chamilio, Smartschool and other internal databases.
